data.title: script
data.meta_description: SCRIPT translations: roteiro, script, escrita, script, escrever o roteiro de, script [masculine], roteiro [masculine…. Learn more in the Cambridge English-Portuguese Dictionary.
data.text:
noun

uk

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/skrɪpt/ us

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/skrɪpt/

FOR FILM, ETC.

B2 [ C ]

the words of a film, play, broadcast, or speech

roteiro, script

Bruce Robinson wrote the script for "The Killing Fields". Bruce Robinson escreveu o roteiro de "Os Gritos do Silêncio".

More examplesFewer examples

Two writers collaborated on the script for the movie.

During certain scenes of the play there isn't any script and the actors just improvise.

The script and the acting are both superb.

He's written the script for a number of successful movies.

It's a great idea for a show but the script lacks a little sparkle.

WRITING

C2 [ U ]

a set of letters used for writing a particular language

escrita

Arabic/Cyrillic/Roman script escrita árabe, escrita cirílica, escrita latina

COMPUTER

[ C or U ] computing specialized

a type of language for programming computers that is used for finding and showing websites on the internet

script

script

verb [ T ]

uk

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/skrɪpt/ us

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/skrɪpt/

to write the words of a film, play, broadcast, or speech

escrever o roteiro de

He scripted the TV series "Homicide".

He's a very good actor, but the part was scripted for an older person. Ele escreveu o roteiro da série de TV "Homicídio".

(Translation of script from the Cambridge English-Portuguese Dictionary © Cambridge University Press)

Translation of script | GLOBAL English–Portuguese Dictionary

script

noun

/skrɪpt/

[ countable ]

the words to be said in a movie

script [ masculine ] roteiro [ masculine ]

Who wrote the script? Quem escreveu o roteiro?

(Translation of script from the GLOBAL English-Portuguese Dictionary © 2021 K Dictionaries Ltd)

Examples of script

script

At each recall, subjects were given the script title and then asked to give a verbal account of the story.

At least two pitfalls of using scripts that are too restricting may be pointed out.

Subjects tend to speak 'off script', which yields much more meaningful material.

If an action in the script did not ring true, the actor had to imagine circumstances that made it meaningful.

In this case, bilingualism accompanied by biliteracy eventually resulted in more advanced understanding of the symbolic relation between letters and sounds in an alphabetic script.

The king's script is contained inside the king's reported speech, which is contained inside the king's narrative.

Some data suggest that the type of script has an effect on the oral reading performance of patients with bilingual aphasia.

The device contains a set of useful everyday scripts.

These examples are from corpora and from sources on the web. Any opinions in the examples do not represent the opinion of the Cambridge Dictionary editors or of Cambridge University Press or its licensors.

B2,C2
